newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela chamber calls for Las Cristinas decision.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela chamber calls for Las Cristinas decision.

text.p: Venezuela's Mining Chamber CAMIVEN called for a decision on the legal dispute between Placer Dome Inc and Crystallex International Corp over the Las Cristinas gold concession in Venezuela.

The legal battle "has become another cause of the flight of foreign and domestic investment which could be made in the mining sector in the short term," CAMIVEN President Pedro Tinoco was quoted as saying in a release.
Placer Dome was due to start the $576 million project at Las Cristinas in May as part of a joint venture with state holding Corporacion Venezolana de Guayana (CVG).
Placer's claim to the concession in southeastern Venezuela has been ratified verbally by government officials.
But Crystallex insists it acquired blocks four and six of Las Cristinas by buying local company Inversora Mael CA.
The Venezuelan Supreme Court has published Crystallex' claim but has not made a decision on the dispute.

Tinoco said the uncertainty surrounding Las Cristinas -- the most important gold mining development to take place in Venezuela for decades -- was typical of the legal problems which had driven away potential investors from the sector.
